show_image.title: show_image
show_image.tooltip: Takes an input tensor in CHW layout and display it as an image
show_image.externalImports:
from matplotlib import pyplot as plt
import torchvision.transforms as T
import numpy as np
show_image.sourceCode:
{{indent}}def show_image(imgs, titles=None, cmap=None, figSize=(9, 5)):
{{indent}}	fix, axs = plt.subplots(ncols=len(imgs), squeeze=False, figsize=figSize)
{{indent}}	for i, img in enumerate(imgs):
{{indent}}		img = T.ToPILImage()(img.to('cpu'))
{{indent}}		axs[0, i].imshow(np.asarray(img), cmap)
{{indent}}		axs[0, i].axis('off')
{{indent}}		if titles and titles[i]:
{{indent}}			axs[0, i].set_title(titles[i])
{{indent}}		axs[0, i].set(xticklabels=[], yticklabels=[], xticks=[], yticks=[])
{{indent}}show_image({{{inputs.1}}}, {{{inputs.2}}}, {{{inputs.3}}}, {{{inputs.4}}})
{{{outputs.1}}}

image.title: image(s)
image.tooltip: input (Tensor[channels, image_height, image_width] | list[Tensor[channels, image_height, image_width]]).

titles.title: titles
titles.tooltip: titles (list[str], optional) - A list of titles to be set for each image. Default: None.

cmap.title: cmap
cmap.tooltip: cmap(str, optional) - The registered colormap name in matplotlib used to map scalar data to colors.

figSize.title: figSize
figSize.tooltip: figSize 2-tuple of floats, default: (9, 5) - Figure dimension (width, height) in inches
